duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide quality nursing care to residents and supervise the day-to-day activities of nursing assistants in accordance with federal, state, & local laws and organization policies.
Ensure compliance with written policies and procedures, and implement resident care plans.
Communicate effectively with residents, staff, families, and visitors, interpreting facility policies.
Review, investigate, and document all incidents/accidents, and evaluate emergency situations, taking appropriate action.
Perform administrative duties, including completing medical forms, reports, evaluations, charting, etc., as necessary.
Admit, transfer, and discharge residents as required, and ensure adequate medications, supplies, and equipment are available.

Conduct all responsibilities in accordance with safety and infection control policies and procedures, including thorough hand washing, use of disposable gloves, and proper disposal of soiled materials.
Conduct all responsibilities in a manner that exhibits the organization's mission, vision, and core values.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an accredited nursing program
Current, unencumbered Massachusetts nursing license as an LPN/RN
Previous nursing experience in a supervisory role preferred
